ref.mixed-citation: American Association for Long-Term Care Insurance. 2015. “The 2015-2016 Sourcebook for Long-Term Care Insurance Information” www.aaltci.org.

Cramer, Anne Theisen and Gail A. Jensen. 2008. “Why Do People Change Their Minds? Evidence from the Purchase of Long-Term Care Insurance.” In Psychology of Decision Making in Economics, Business and Finance. P. Hofmann Klaus, ed., 179-193.Hauppauge, NY: Nova Science Publishers.
Finkelstein, Amy and Kathleen McGarry (2006). “Multiple Dimensions of Private Information: Evidence from the Long-Term Care Insurance Market” American Economic Review Vol. 96 No. 4 Pages 938-958.

Finkelstein, Amy, Kathleen McGarry, and Amir Sufi. 2005a. “Dynamic Inefficiencies in Insurance Markets: Evidence from Long-Term Care Insurance.” National Bureau of Economic Research Working Paper No. 11039.
Finkelstein, Amy, Kathleen McGarry, and Amir Sufi. 2005b. “Dynamic Inefficiencies in Insurance Markets: Evidence from Long-Term Care.” American Economic Review 95(2): 224-228.

Hou, Wenliang, Wei Sun, and Anthony Webb. 2015. “Why Do People Lapse Their Long-Term Care Insurance?” Boston College Center for Retirement Research Issue Brief #15-17.
Hurd, Michael, P. Martorell, A. Delavande, K. Mullen, and K. Langa. 2013. “Monetary costs of dementia in the United States.” New England Journal of Medicine 368, pp. 1326-1334.
Ko, Ami. 2016. “An Equilibrium Analysis of the Long-Term Care Insurance Market.” Draft, University of Pennsylvania.
